channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-20587] Replace Jackson with shaded thirdparty gson
item.description:
HBASE-20582 got me looking at how we use Jackson. It appears that we moved some JSON code from hbase-server into hbase-common via HBASE-19053. But, there seems to be no good reason why this code should live there and not in hbase-http instead. Keeping Jackson off the user's classpath is a nice goal.

FYI appy, mdrob
item.summary: Replace Jackson with shaded thirdparty gson

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Argh, missed that hbase-client still has a reference to Jackson's JsonMapper.

Looks like we can't rip out Jackson from the hbase-client as all operations (e.g. Get, Put) use it for implementing toString().

Can still pull it out of hbase-common and put that server-side in hbase-http.
You mean our JsonMapper has a reference to Jackson's ObjectMapper.
should we shade jackson in hbase-thirdparty?

You mean our JsonMapper has a reference to Jackson's ObjectMapper.

Yes, thank you

should we shade jackson in hbase-thirdparty?

Just had that same thought over on HBASE-20852. I'm not sure if there's a reason we haven't yet shaded it, but that would help.

-1 overall

Let me use this issue to pull Jackson completely out of the client path and replace it with the gson we have in hbase-thirdparty (big thanks to Apache9 for that pointer).
Any updates here?
Nah, haven't gotten around to this yet, Duo. Bumped to 2.2.0. Thanks for checking.
elserj Any updates here, sir? If not, will move this to 2.3.0. Thanks.
Moved it out. Need to come back
I can work on this if you do not mind elserj.
Our rest framework also uses jackson and the replace work is not straight-forward so do not include it. Can do it in another issue I think.

No qualms here, thanks for picking it up!

Your first patch looks OK, but seems like might have caused some of those test failures. I'm sure you're on that already.

I see you were fixing some other style/static-analysis things while you were in some files. Bloats the patch a little, but probably better long term. Thanks for having an eye out for them.
Let's land HBASE-21939 first, and then in this issue we can completely remove the jackson dependencies, not only for client.

Give up on HBASE-21939 for now as we also use jackson for xml...

Let's resolve this first...

Pushed to branch-2.2+.

Thanks all for reviewing.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: Remove jackson dependencies from most hbase modules except hbase-rest, use shaded gson instead. The output json will be a bit different since jackson can use getter/setter, but gson will always use the fields.
